docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 (U.P.) -- Dr. Enrique de Lozada, confidential agent in Washington of the new revolutionary Bolivian Government, reigned today coincident with intimations that the State Department this week might formally announce its refusal to...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 23 (U.P.) -- Dr. Enrique de Lozada, confidential agent in Washington of the new revolutionary Bolivian Government, reigned today coincident with intimations that the State Department this week might formally announce its refusal to recognize the La Paz regime.
docs.abstract: to be Bolivian confidential agent in Wash

headline.main: BOLIVIAN AIDE HERE RESIGNS HIS OFFICE; Dr. Lozada Says New Regime Is Non-Representative -- Junta Faces Disavowal

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 24 -- The State Department announced today that the United States would not recognize the revolutionary regime in Bolivia.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 24 -- The State Department announced today that the United States would not recognize the revolutionary regime in Bolivia.

headline.main: TIE WITH BOLIVIA REJECTED BY U.S.; HOSTILE LINK SEEN; Economic Steps May Be Taken Against Regime That Seized Power -- Envoy Recalled FIVE MORE NATIONS ACT Brazil Among Them -- Britain May Join In -- Washington Note Omits Argentina SUMMONED HOME TIE WITH BOLIVIA REJECTED BY U.S.

byline.original: By BERTRAM D. HULENSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 25 -- Foreign Minister Alberto Gilbert, speaking to the press, tonight announced the Argentine Government would take severe measures against German espionage. The case against the Germans, he said, has been fully proved and the...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 25 -- Foreign Minister Alberto Gilbert, speaking to the press, tonight announced the Argentine Government would take severe measures against German espionage. The case against the Germans, he said, has been fully proved and the Government is determined to end such activities once and for all because they injure Argentina's good name and national honor.
docs.abstract: announces plan to act against Ger espionage activities

headline.main: BUENOS AIRES ACTS; Decision on Severe Step Against Nazis to Be Announced Today MONTEVIDEO SEES BREAK Says Diplomats Were Told of Rupture -- Newspapers Blazon Betrayal by Reich BUENOS AIRES ACTS TO CURB NAZI SPIES

byline.original: By ARNALDO CORTESIBy Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LONDON, Jan. 25 -- Foreign Secretary Anthony Eden's announcement in Parliament today that Britain does not recognize the revolutionary junta in Bolivia was overshadowed tonight by the report that Argentina was on the verge of breaking relations with...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Jan. 25 -- Foreign Secretary Anthony Eden's announcement in Parliament today that Britain does not recognize the revolutionary junta in Bolivia was overshadowed tonight by the report that Argentina was on the verge of breaking relations with Germany.

headline.main: LA PAZ RECOGNITION BARRED BY BRITAIN; Eden, Announcing Refusal to Accept Bolivian Junta, Sees German Hand in Coup SPAIN'S ROLE QUESTIONED But Foreign Secretary Avoids Point -- More Latin-American Countries Shun Neighbor

byline.original: By Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The stock market bogged down yesterday as interest dwindled and prices eased to an irregularly lower close. Spots of strength appeared in distilling and public utility issues, but not in other major sections. Trading on the Stock Exchange was the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The stock market bogged down yesterday as interest dwindled and prices eased to an irregularly lower close. Spots of strength appeared in distilling and public utility issues, but not in other major sections. Trading on the Stock Exchange was the slowest since the first session of the year, involving only 595,190 shares, against 778,495 on Wednesday.

headline.main: STOCK SALES SLOW; PRICES IRREGULAR; Liquor and Utility Issues Show Most Strength -- Rail and Latin Bonds Advance

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 28 -- The Argentine military Government of President Pedro Ramirez was split wide open tonight as a result of the country's severance of diplomatic relations with the Axis.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 28 -- The Argentine military Government of President Pedro Ramirez was split wide open tonight as a result of the country's severance of diplomatic relations with the Axis.
docs.abstract: Argentina cuts services to Axis countries

headline.main: Argentine Envoy to Brazil Resigns In Repercussions Over Axis Break; Argentine Ambassador to Brazil Resigns In Repercussions Over Break With the Axis

docs.snippet: In Nazi plans for world domination the twenty Latin-American nations were to have played an important part. They were considered fertile fields for Nazi doctrine and exploitation and, if necessary, vulnerable gateways for military invasion of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: In Nazi plans for world domination the twenty Latin-American nations were to have played an important part. They were considered fertile fields for Nazi doctrine and exploitation and, if necessary, vulnerable gateways for military invasion of the Western Hemisphere.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED JAN. 29, 1944
